definition[0]: a small copy of a building, vehicle, machine etc, especially one that can be put together from separate parts
example[0]: a working model  (=one with parts which move) of a steam engine
example[1]: They showed us a model of the building.
definition[1]: someone whose job is to show clothes, hairstyles etc by wearing them at fashion shows or for photographs
definition[2]: a particular type or design of a vehicle or machine
example[4]: Renault are introducing three new models at the show.
example[5]: Our dishwasher is the latest model  (=newest design).
definition[3]: a computer representation or scientific description of something
example[7]: Scientists are building computer models of the ocean currents.
definition[4]: someone or something which people want to copy because they are successful or have good qualities
example[8]: He used English medieval architecture as his model.
example[9]: Good teachers can act as positive role models.
example[10]: It served as a model for other cities.
definition[5]: someone who is employed by an artist or photographer to be painted or photographed
definition[6]: to wear clothes at a fashion show or in magazine photographs in order to show them to people
example[11]: She’s modeling Donna Karan’s fall collection.
example[12]: Claire modelled for a few years when she was in her twenties.
definition[7]: to do a computer representation or scientific description of a situation or event
example[13]: They used a computer to model the possible effects of global warming.
definition[8]: to make something by shaping clay, wood etc
example[14]: the cheapest model in the Volkswagen range
example[15]: Our photocopier is the latest model.
definition[9]: a simple description or structure that is used to help people understand similar systems or structures
example[17]: a computer model of the main factors determining a company’s market share
definition[10]: the way in which something is done by a particular country, person etc that can be copied by others who want similar results
example[18]: the American model of airline deregulation
